text:
Follow us Angelina Jolie cries on BBC as she speaks about divorce from Brad Pitt for the first time Sarah Robertson for Metro.co.uk Sunday 19 Feb 2017 11:46 pm Angelina Jolie looked teary eyed as she spoke about divorcing Brad Pitt (Picture: BBC) 
She’s famously reticent about her private life but Angelina Jolie choked up as she spoke candidly for the first time about divorcing Brad Pitt. 
In an interview with BBC World News about her new film about on the genocide in Cambodia, the actress and UN special envoy revealed it is a ‘very difficult time’ not just for her but their whole family. 
There was an audible intake of breath and ten-second pause when the interviewer asked her about the incident, to which Angelina replied: ‘I don’t want to say much about that, except to say it was a very difficult time and we are a family and we always will be a family and we will get through this time and hopefully be a stronger family for it.’ The star had to look away and compose herself (Picture: BBC) 
The actress, 41, split from Brad, 53, last September after 12 years together in what has become one of Hollywood’s most acrimonious divorces. 
The couple have been locked in a bitter custody over their six children – Maddox, 15, Pax, 13, Zahara, 12, Shiloh, ten, and eight year-old twins, Knox and Vivienne – but the Beyond The Sea star revealed they are putting their children first. The actress said it had been a ‘difficult time’ for the entire family 
‘Many many people find themselves in this situation. We’ve all been through a difficult time – my focus is my children, our children, and my focus is finding this way through,’ she said. 
‘We are and forever will be a family and so that is how I am coping, I’m coping with finding a way through to make sure that this somehow makes us stronger and closer.’ More
